name: sfchronicle
text:
Erica Chan Coffman and her family were renovating a home in Sonoma County for the past three years as a getaway and vacation rental. Then the Glass Fire erupted.

A firefighter checking on the property a day later snapped photos of what remained.

https://t.co/w7JGr6DBMF https://t.co/EaBrMT9gZQ

name: sfchronicle
text:
Here’s a list of the Napa Valley wineries that have been confirmed to have sustained damage in the #GlassFire. 

https://t.co/23Jrl4HOH6

name: sfchronicle
text:
A federal appeals court refused to allow the Trump administration to shut down the 2020 census before the Oct. 31 deadline, allowing the continuation of population-counting that is crucial for federal funding and congressional representation.

https://t.co/4w2SA4ePXZ

name: sfchronicle
text:

name: sfchronicle
text:
Mill Valley Film festival is happening on your screen and at the drive-in from October 8 - 18, 2020. Chronicle members can win a general admission voucher to watch a film at the festival.
https://t.co/fBStj2Awig

name: sfchronicle
text:
The #49ers ranked 2nd in the NFL in rushing last season and had the most rushing yards in a conference championship game since 1970. But missing RBs and missed assignments have helped grind their ground game to a halt the past two weeks.

via @eric_branch: https://t.co/OYSo1dVTPU

name: sfchronicle
text:
Launched with big ambitions, California Sunday Magazine ceases publication.

via @RyanKost: https://t.co/KuGxPb47Q0

name: sfchronicle
text: Santa Rosa residents impacted by the #GlassFire can now pick up re-entry safety materials (masks, gloves, hand sanitizer, shoe covers and more) and information at “supply and support stations” before returning to their homes, officials said. https://t.co/nVdQrF7JIe

name: sfchronicle
text: In her response to the first question posed in the vice presidential debate, Democratic candidate Kamala Harris said President Trump’s handling of the pandemic was the “greatest failure of any presidential administration in the history of our country.” https://t.co/NJ9CoqnPMG

name: sfchronicle
text:
A’s second baseman Tommy La Stella avoided serious injury when he was hit by a pitch on the right elbow Wednesday but his status for Game 4 is uncertain, manager Bob Melvin said.

https://t.co/10jKVkF8UT

name: sfchronicle
text:
Tonight's vice presidential debate will be anything but an afterthought, as voters can easily envision either of the running mates having to step into the top spot.

Here are some things to watch for: https://t.co/OG0WjXWID3

name: sfchronicle
text:
There is a historic aspect to Wednesday’s debate: Sen. Kamala Harris will be the first woman of color to participate in a presidential or vice presidential debate.

Much of who she is today traces back to her childhood in Berkeley.

https://t.co/MMfZHlR4e9

name: sfchronicle
text:
The Sharks drafted eight forwards on Day 2 of the NHL’s virtual 2020 draft. And, fittingly, the prospects’ futures are about as uncertain as the league’s.

“We don’t know when we’re going to start," Sharks general manager Doug Wilson said.

https://t.co/v5ufwJy3FU

name: sfchronicle
text:
The good news is that the vice presidential debate was nothing like last week’s unlistenable cacophony between President Trump and Joe Biden. The bad news is that it was too much like most other debates.

The Chronicle's takeaways from tonight's VP debate: https://t.co/6YRSsutryp
